1-1.original: בְּרֵאשִׁית בָּרָא אֱלֹהִים אֵת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְאֵת הָאָרֶץ
1-1.kjv: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
1-1.esv: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
1-1.amplified: In the beginning [before all time] God (Elohim—Father, Son, Holy Spirit) created [by forming from nothing] the heavens and the earth.
notes: H430 Elohim is plural in form, used with singular verbs - a hint of the Trinity
H1254 bara - to create from nothing, used only of divine creation

1-2.original: וְהָאָרֶץ הָיְתָה תֹהוּ וָבֹהוּ וְחֹשֶׁךְ עַל־פְּנֵי תְהוֹם וְרוּחַ אֱלֹהִים מְרַחֶפֶת עַל־פְּנֵי הַמָּיִם
1-2.kjv: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
1-2.esv: The earth was without form and void, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters.
1-2.amplified: The earth was formless and void [a waste—empty and dark], and darkness was upon the face of the deep [primeval ocean]. The Spirit of God was moving (hovering, brooding) over the face of the waters.
notes: H7307 ruach - Spirit, wind, or breath. Here clearly the Spirit of God.
H7363 rachaph - to hover, brood (like a bird over its nest)

1-3.kjv: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
1-3.esv: And God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.
1-3.amplified: And God said, "Let there be light"; and there was light [the creation of light was immediate].
notes: H216 or - light, both physical light and metaphorical enlightenment
